voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
Welcome to your Japanese learning session. We will be focusing on more body parts today: the eye, ear, mouth, and nose.
We'll begin with the word for 'eye'. In Japanese, 'eye' is said as

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . Let's repeat: 'Eye' is

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . As an example, we could say "My eyes are blue." which translates to:

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . One more time for pronunciation: "My eyes are blue." is

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
.
Next, we are going to talk about the word for 'ear'. In Japanese, 'ear' is

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . Let's practice: 'Ear' is

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . For instance, "Do you hear that with your ear?" translates to:

lang.mstts:prosody: それをあなたの耳で聞きますか？

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . Let's repeat this phrase: "Do you hear that with your ear?" is

lang.mstts:prosody: それをあなたの耳で聞きますか？

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
.
Next up, 'mouth' is expressed in Japanese as

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . Please pronounce: 'Mouth' is

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . Here is a sample sentence: "I eat rice with my mouth.", which is

lang.mstts:prosody: 私の口でご飯を食べます

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . Repeat after me: "I eat rice with my mouth." translates to

lang.mstts:prosody: 私の口でご飯を食べます

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
.
Finally, we will discuss the word for 'nose' which in Japanese is

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . Again, 'nose' is

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . Let's use it in a sentence: "My nose is big." which translates to:

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . One more time, "My nose is big." is

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
.
By the end of this lesson, we have learned to say 'eye' as

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: , 'ear' as

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: , 'mouth' as

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: , and 'nose' as

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
.
Well done on completing this lesson! Continue to practice these new vocabulary words until they come naturally to you. See you next time!
